JOINT SURPSTRAR1/2/1
You are my wife. In consideration of the love I have for you, I hereby transfer to you, free of charge and with full rights, the immovable property of my forefathers, valued at Rs. 3,03,000/- (literally three lakh three thousand rupees) as per the schedule below, without any consideration from you, and I hereby issue this settlement deed. You, your son, grandson, and descendants shall enjoy the property in peace and freedom with all the rights of donation, exchange, use, sale, and enjoyment, subject to payment of all taxes due to the Sri Panchayat from the property as per the schedule. I hereby waive all claims, disputes, and all other claims, disputes, and other claims, whether arising from any cause or from any person, and at my own expense, and hereby grant you and your heirs the right to enforce this Settlement Deed without interruption. I am the one who can enforce this Settlement Deed without interruption. I hereby certify that the said property is free from all encumbrances, mortgages, charges, sales, sales agreements and any other encumbrances or rights and liabilities and that all the particulars in this Schedule are correct and that the property as entered in the Schedule is not subject to any encumbrance, mortgage, etc., to the Government of the State or its affiliated institutions. I hereby give you my full and complete assurance that this settlement document has been written and delivered. The said property has not been assigned by the Government of Sri A.P. vide Act No. 9/77. In order to register your name in the accounts of the Revenue Department, you are hereby required to file the forms for transfer of title etc.

If you can prove to the contrary that the Scheduled Property does not contain any coconut or other fruit orchards, trees, mines, mines, minerals, missionaries, fish ponds, etc., then you will be liable to pay depreciation duty as per sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act.

Indipi Kayalasyam RayalusSheet Endorsement

Section 22-B Registration Act - 1908
Declaration
This declaration is hereby notified That is, in the context of preparing this document, I / we have brought all the necessary documents such as the details of the property in the document, the details of the fields, 1B, copies of the link documents, tax receipts for the places and houses, details of the parties in the link document, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, property details, etc. and have examined all the aspects thoroughly and included them in this document and prepared the document. No matter that should be written or included has been left out in this document. The schedule property has been physically examined and measured and the document has been drawn up. I/We declare that the said property has not been sold/transferred to you/us, that the said property is undisputed property, that there are no dues payable on the said property and that I/We am/will be able to pay the stamp duty found in the inspection of the said property by the authorities (Registration & Stamps, Revenue Department) in the future. I/We have not violated the provisions of Section 22-B of the Registration Act - 1908 and I/We am/we are fully responsible for all other matters. Neither the Sub-Registrar nor the Registrar of Deeds have any connection with it. I/We shall be held responsible for any and all claims that may arise in the future if it is found that the sale/purchase of this property is not made by the Government, Endowment, Vacs Board and Assignee. I/We have read this document in its entirety and hereby give my/our full consent in writing. Annexure - III
"I/We hereby declare that property mentioned in the Document belongs to me
and was not alienated earlier and if it is found to have been violated the provisions of
Section 22-B of Registration Act 1908, I/We would be liable for penal action 82 of
Registration Act 1908"

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 977 of 2026, dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Indipikayala Satyanarayana in favour of his Wife, Indipikayala Parvathi towards the property admeasuring an extent of 121 Sq. Yds., being house number 1-142, Assessment number 142, comprised in Survey Number 643, situated in Neeladripuram Village, Kadiyadda Grama Panchayath, Tadepalligudem Mandal, within the District of West Godavari, registered at Sub-Registrar office Tadepalligudem, bounded as follows: North: Vacant Site of Bhimavarapu Venkatrao South: Panchayath Road East: Panchayath Road West: Rcc House of Tattugolla Subbayya Note: Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
